tool.name: bcftools @EXECUTABLE@
tool.description: Copy number variation caller, requires Illumina's B-allele frequency (BAF) and Log R Ratio intensity (LRR)
tool.command:
@PREPARE_INPUT_FILE@ #set $section = $sec_restrict @PREPARE_TARGETS_FILE@
bcftools @EXECUTABLE@
--output-dir cnv_tmp
## General section #set $section = $sec_general ### @CONTROL_SAMPLE@ #if $section.control_sample: --control-sample "${section.control_sample}" #end if ### @QUERY_SAMPLE@ #if $section.query_sample: --query-sample "${section.query_sample}" #end if @AF_FILE@
### @PLOT_THRESHOLD@ #if $section.plot_threshold: --plot-threshold "${section.plot_threshold}" #end if
## HMM section #set $section = $sec_hmm ### @ABERRANT@ #if $section.aberrant_query or $section.aberrant_control: #set $query_val = #if $section.aberrant_query then $section.aberrant_query else '1.0'# #set $control_val = #if $section.aberrant_control then $section.aberrant_control else '1.0'# --aberrant "${query_val},${control_val}" #end if ### @BAF_WEIGHT@ #if $section.BAF_weight: --BAF-weight "${section.BAF_weight}" #end if ### @BAF_DEV@ #if $section.BAF_dev_query or $section.BAF_dev_control: #set $query_val = #if $section.BAF_dev_query then $section.BAF_dev_query else '1.0'# #set $control_val = #if $section.BAF_dev_control then $section.BAF_dev_control else '1.0'# --BAF-dev "${query_val},${control_val}" #end if ### @LRR_WEIGHT@ #if $section.LRR_weight: --LRR-weight "${section.LRR_weight}" #end if ### @LRR_DEV@ #if $section.LRR_dev_query or $section.LRR_dev_control: #set $query_val = #if $section.LRR_dev_query then $section.LRR_dev_query else '1.0'# #set $control_val = #if $section.LRR_dev_control then $section.LRR_dev_control else '1.0'# --LRR-dev "${query_val},${control_val}" #end if ### @LRR_SMOOTH_WIN@ #if $section.LRR_smooth_win: --LRR-smooth-win "${section.LRR_smooth_win}" #end if ### @OPTIMIZE@ #if $section.optimize: --optimize "${section.optimize}" #end if ### @SAME_PROB@ #if $section.same_prob: --same-prob "${section.same_prob}" #end if ### @ERR_PROB@ #if $section.err_prob: --err-prob "${section.err_prob}" #end if ### @XY_PROB@ #if $section.xy_prob: --xy-prob "${section.xy_prob}" #end if
## Filter section #set $section = $sec_restrict @REGIONS@ @TARGETS@
## Primary Input/Outputs @INPUT_FILE@ && cp $output_dir/cn.*.tab "$output_cn" && cp $output_dir/dat.*.tab "$output_dat" && cp $output_dir/summary.*.tab "$output_summary" ## && python $output_dir/plot.*.py

param.name: control_sample
param.label: Control Sample
param.help: optional control sample name to highlight differences

param.name: plot_threshold
param.label: Plot Threshold
param.help: plot aberrant chromosomes with quality at least 'float'

param.name: optimize
param.label: Optimize
param.help: iteratively estimate the fraction of aberrant cells, down to the given fraction. Lowering this value from the default 1.0 to say, 0.3, can help discover more events but also increases noise.

param.name: same_prob
param.label: Same Prob
param.help: the prior probability of the query and the control sample being the same. Setting to 0 calls both independently, setting to 1 forces the same copy number state in both.

param.name: xy_prob
param.label: Xy Prob
param.help: the HMM probability of transition to another copy number state. Increasing this value leads to smaller and more frequent calls.

param.name: aberrant_query
param.label: Aberrant Query
param.help: fraction of aberrant cells in query, defaults to 1.

param.name: aberrant_control
param.label: Aberrant Control
param.help: fraction of aberrant cells in control, defaults to 1.

param.name: BAF_dev_query
param.label: Baf Query Deviation
param.help: expected BAF deviation in query, defaults to: 0.04

param.name: BAF_dev_control
param.label: Baf Control Deviation
param.help: expected BAF deviation in control, defaults to: 0.04

param.name: LRR_weight
param.label: LRR Weight
param.help: Relative contribution from LRR. With noisy data, this option can have big effect on the number of calls produced. In truly random noise (such as in simulated data), the value should be set high (1.0), i but in the presence of systematic noise when LRR are not informative, lower values result in cleaner calls (0.2).

param.name: LRR_dev_query
param.label: LRR Query Deviation
param.help: expected LRR deviation in query, default is: 0.2

param.name: LRR_dev_control
param.label: LRR Control Deviation
param.help: expected LRR deviation in control, default is: 0.2

param.name: LRR_smooth_win
param.label: Lrr Smooth Win
param.help: window of LRR moving average smoothing
